#summary Accounts (v2.0 rev1.0)
#sidebar OpenAPIv20r10Sidebar

[OpenAPIDocIndex  OpenAPI Documentation Index]

<h1>Get all accounts (v2.0 rev1.0)</h1><p>Provides all valid accounts of a user for a given location like Ulm or Austin. Access to this function is restricted. SSee [OpenAPIOAuthr10 OAuth  documentation] for more details. The only supported HTTP method is GET.</p><table class="funcdetail"><tr><td class="funcdetailheader">Access:</td><td>protected</td></tr><tr><td class="funcdetailheader">URL:</td><td>https://www.car2go.com/api/v2.0/accounts</td></tr><tr><td class="funcdetailheader">Method:</td><td>GET</td></tr></table><h3>Parameters</h3><table class="parameters"><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Mandatory</th><th>Description</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>loc</td><td>true</td><td> location identifier string of the user's home location, e.g. "ulm", "austin".</td></tr><tr><td>format</td><td>false</td><td> defines response format. Value "json" => JSON format, otherwise xml format is used</td></tr><tr><td>callback</td><td>false</td><td> defines JSONP (JSON with Padding) callback function used as wrapper</td></tr></tbody></table><h3>Request Examples</h3><div class="sample"><pre>GET https://www.car2go.com/api/v2.0/accounts?loc=ulm&format=json</pre></div><div class="sample"><pre>GET https://www.car2go.com/api/v2.0/accounts?loc=austin</pre></div><h3>Response</h3>The XML file defines a accountResponse tag to receive all valid accounts for any car2go user. The accountResponse tag
                  defines following sub tags:
                  <ul>
                  <li>returnValue - see list of return codes below and <a href="index.html#returnvalues">return values</a> for more details</li>
                  </ul>
                  <ul>
                  <li>account - only for successful return value, i.e. code = 0. Contains a list of all found accounts with following sub
                  tags:
                  <ul>
                  <li>accountId - the unique identifier of this account</li>
                  <li>description - detailed description of the account</li>
                  </ul>
                  </li>
                  </ul>
<h3>Response Examples</h3><div class="sample">A XML response example where user has valid account:
<blockquote>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
  	{{{<accountResponse xmlns="http://www.car2go.com/openapi/xmlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">}}}
 		{{{<returnValue>}}}
 			{{{<code>}}}0{{{</code>}}}
 			{{{<description>}}}Operation successful.{{{</description>}}}
 		{{{</returnValue>}}}
 		{{{<account>}}}
 			{{{<accountId>}}}58{{{</accountId>}}}
 			{{{<description>}}}{{{</description>}}}
 		{{{</account>}}}
 	{{{</accountResponse>}}}
</blockquote></div>
<div class="sample">A XML response example where user does not have valid account:
 
<blockquote>
 <?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot; standalone=&quot;yes&quot;?>
  	{{{<accountResponse xmlns="http://www.car2go.com/openapi/xmlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">}}}
 		{{{<returnValue>}}}
 			{{{<code>}}}3{{{</code>}}}
 			{{{<description>}}}No valid accounts found.{{{</description>}}}
 		{{{</returnValue>}}}
 	{{{</accountResponse>}}}
</blockquote></div>
<div class="sample">A JSON response example:
 <pre>
 {"returnValue":{"code":0,"description":"Operation successful."},"account":[{"accountId":994,"description":"Max Mustermann11585"}]}</pre></div>
<h3>Return Codes</h3>The following return codes may occur:<table><thead><tr><th>Code</th><th>Description</th><th>Note</th></tr></thead><tr><td>0</td><td>Operation successful.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>1</td><td>Location invalid.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>2</td><td>UserId invalid.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>3</td><td>No valid accounts found.</td><td> The user has no valid accounts. This occurs when the user has no account and is not invited to any accounts.</td></tr></table>
